user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: The screenshot displays a list of categories for organizing and searching photos in a mobile app, likely Google Photos. The options include "Videos," "Movies," "Animations," "Collages," "Creations," "PhotoScan," and "Motion Photos." A search bar is also visible at the top to help users find specific content. Additionally, there is a "Show less" option at the bottom.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.
click on the back button "<-" located at the top-left.
click on the "Search your photos" bar located at the top.
click on the "Show more" text located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.

think.Thought: The user is trying to access the 'Creations' section in Google Photos, which is displayed in the current menu. Since 'Creations' is already visible in the list, the next step should be to select it to view the saved creations.
Future Action Plan: Click on 'Creations' to view the saved creations.
